text:
obstetric 
cholestasis. This is a potentially 
dangerous liver disorder 
that seems to run in families, 
although it can occur even 
if there is no family history. 
The main symptom is severe 
generalised itching without a 
rash, most commonly in the 
last four months of pregnancy. 
Obstetric cholestasis can lead 
to premature birth, stillbirth 
or serious health problems 
for your baby. It can also 
increase the risk of maternal 
haemorrhage after the delivery. 
For further information see
